We assessed the vulnerability of lizards distributed along the Great Dividing Range (GDR) in southeastern Australia to climate change. The GDR traverses almost 3,500 km of the Australian continent, running from the west of Alps in southeast Victoria to north of Atherton in northeast Queensland
49 . The GDR is a key conservation area because it harbours globally endemic and endangered species
63 . As a result, it has been earmarked for the creation of a connectivity corridor to enhance species’ mobility and capacity to adapt to climate change
64 .
